speakers.text: Why? 1111 14th Street, NW Suite 400

speakers.name: JUSTICE O'CONNOR
speakers.text: I thought Wesley didn't receive a death sentence.

speakers.name: JUSTICE SCALIA
speakers.text: No. That's -- that's my mistake.

speakers.name: JUSTICE SOUTER
speakers.text: Okay. He didn't receive the - - the death penalty. What would his argument be with respect to guilt or innocence? It seems to me that the issue only goes to penalty.

speakers.name: JUSTICE SOUTER
speakers.text: But that's Stumpf's case.

speakers.name: JUSTICE SOUTER
speakers.text: Yes. So I mean - -

speakers.name: JUSTICE SOUTER
speakers.text: I don't see where Wesley - -

speakers.name: JUSTICE SOUTER
speakers.text: So -- so Wesley would have neither a -- a due process claim with respect to sentence nor with respect to guilt.

speakers.name: JUSTICE GINSBURG
speakers.text: But now your -- your part about the guilt, the Sixth Circuit agreed with you because it vacated not only the sentence, but the conviction. And what is your argument that the conviction is infirm?

speakers.name: JUSTICE SOUTER
speakers.text: I -- I thought the -- the specific intent element would be satisfied if -- if they, by plan, went to the scene with -- with deadly weapons.

speakers.name: JUSTICE GINSBURG
speakers.text: I thought the State argued that knowledge -- that there's this plan, and they had a common design to rob. Is that right? And then the State said that common design plus knowledge that an inherently dangerous instrument would be employed to perpetuate the felony or that the felony and its manner of accomplishment would be reasonably likely to produce death. That's what the State argued was the law of Ohio.

speakers.name: JUSTICE GINSBURG
speakers.text: Did -- did any judge say 1111 14th Street, NW Suite 400 that, any judge on the Sixth Circuit say that that was the Ohio law?

speakers.name: CHIEF JUSTICE REHNQUIST
speakers.text: Thank you, Mr. 1111 14th Street, NW Suite 400 Freedman. Mr. Cole, you have 3 minutes remaining.

speakers.name: JUSTICE SOUTER
speakers.text: You -- you mean at the hearing on the motion to vacate.

speakers.name: CHIEF JUSTICE REHNQUIST
speakers.text: Thank you, Mr. Cole. The case is submitted.
